edu.stanford.cs.pptx

Class PPPath

  • Object
    • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPPath

  • public class PPPath
extends Object
    This class defines a path consisting of line segments, arc segments, and cubic bezier curves.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PPPath()
      Creates a new empty path.

      • arcTo

        public void arcTo(double rx,
                  double ry,
                  double start,
                  double sweep)
        Draws an arc from the current point. The parameters rx and ry indicate the radii of the ellipse from which the arc is taken; start and sweep represent the starting and sweep angles of the arc, which implicitly define the center of the arc. All angles are measured in degrees counterclockwise from the +x axis.
        Parameters:
        rx - The radius of the ellipse in the x direction
        ry - The radius of the ellipse in the y direction
        start - The start angle of the arc
        sweep - The sweep angle of the arc

      • curveTo

        public void curveTo(double x1,
                    double y1,
                    double x2,
                    double y2,
                    double x3,
                    double y3)
        Draws a Bezier curve using the specified control points.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x coordinate of the first control point
        y1 - The y coordinate of the first control point
        x2 - The x coordinate of the second control point
        y2 - The y coordinate of the second control point
        x3 - The x coordinate of the endpoint
        y3 - The y coordinate of the endpoint

        Parameters:

        p2 - The second control point
        p3 - The endpoint
